info.title: Kubeflow Pipelines API
info.description: This file contains REST API specification for Kubeflow Pipelines. The file is autogenerated from the swagger definition.

get.summary: Finds all experiments. Supports pagination, and sorting on certain fields.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token to request the next page of results. The token is acquried
from the nextPageToken field of the response from the previous
ListExperiment call or can be omitted when fetching the first page.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of experiments to be listed per page. If there are more
experiments than this number, the response message will contain a
nextPageToken field you can use to fetch the next page.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Can be format of "field_name", "field_name asc" or "field_name desc"
Ascending by default.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A url-encoded, JSON-serialized Filter protocol buffer (see
[filter.proto](https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/backend/api/v1beta1/filter.proto)).

parameters.name: resource_reference_key.type
parameters.description: The type of the resource that referred to.

parameters.name: resource_reference_key.id
parameters.description: The ID of the resource that referred to.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The experiment to be created.

get.summary: Finds a specific experiment by ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the experiment to be retrieved.

delete.summary:
Deletes an experiment without deleting the experiment's runs and jobs. To
avoid unexpected behaviors, delete an experiment's runs and jobs before
deleting the experiment.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the experiment to be deleted.

post.summary: Archives an experiment and the experiment's runs and jobs.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the experiment to be archived.

post.summary:
Restores an archived experiment. The experiment's archived runs and jobs
will stay archived.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the experiment to be restored.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token to request the next page of results. The token is acquried
from the nextPageToken field of the response from the previous
ListRuns call or can be omitted when fetching the first page.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of runs to be listed per page. If there are more runs than this
number, the response message will contain a nextPageToken field you can use
to fetch the next page.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Can be format of "field_name", "field_name asc" or "field_name desc"
(Example, "name asc" or "id desc"). Ascending by default.

parameters.name: resource_reference_key.type
parameters.description: The type of the resource that referred to.

parameters.name: resource_reference_key.id
parameters.description: The ID of the resource that referred to.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A url-encoded, JSON-serialized Filter protocol buffer (see
[filter.proto](https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/backend/api/v1beta1/filter.proto)).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to be deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to be archived.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to be restored.

get.summary: Finds a specific run by ID.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to be retrieved.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the run.

parameters.name: node_id
parameters.description: The ID of the running node.

parameters.name: artifact_name
parameters.description: The name of the artifact.

post.summary: Re-initiates a failed or terminated run.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to be retried.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The ID of the run to be terminated.

post.summary:
ReportRunMetrics reports metrics of a run. Each metric is reported in its
own transaction, so this API accepts partial failures. Metric can be
uniquely identified by (run_id, node_id, name). Duplicate reporting will be
ignored by the API. First reporting wins.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: Required. The parent run ID of the metric.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token to request the next page of results. The token is acquried
from the nextPageToken field of the response from the previous
ListJobs call or can be omitted when fetching the first page.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of jobs to be listed per page. If there are more jobs than this
number, the response message will contain a nextPageToken field you can use
to fetch the next page.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Can be format of "field_name", "field_name asc" or "field_name desc".
Ascending by default.

parameters.name: resource_reference_key.type
parameters.description: The type of the resource that referred to.

parameters.name: resource_reference_key.id
parameters.description: The ID of the resource that referred to.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A url-encoded, JSON-serialized Filter protocol buffer (see
[filter.proto](https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/backend/api/v1beta1/filter.proto)).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The job to be created

get.summary: Finds a specific job by ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the job to be retrieved

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the job to be deleted

post.summary: Stops a job and all its associated runs. The job is not deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the job to be disabled

post.summary: Restarts a job that was previously stopped. All runs associated with the job will continue.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the job to be enabled

get.summary: Finds a pipeline by Name (and namespace)

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description:
The Namespace the pipeline belongs to.
In the case of shared pipelines and KFPipeline standalone installation,
the pipeline name is the only needed field for unique resource lookup (namespace is not required).
In those case, please provide hyphen (dash character, "-").

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The Name of the pipeline to be retrieved.

get.summary: Lists all pipeline versions of a given pipeline.

parameters.name: resource_key.type
parameters.description: The type of the resource that referred to.

parameters.name: resource_key.id
parameters.description: The ID of the resource that referred to.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of pipeline versions to be listed per page. If there are more
pipeline versions than this number, the response message will contain a
nextPageToken field you can use to fetch the next page.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token to request the next page of results. The token is acquried
from the nextPageToken field of the response from the previous
ListPipelineVersions call or can be omitted when fetching the first page.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Can be format of "field_name", "field_name asc" or "field_name desc"
Ascending by default.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A base-64 encoded, JSON-serialized Filter protocol buffer (see
filter.proto).

post.summary: Adds a pipeline version to the specified pipeline.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
ResourceReference inside PipelineVersion specifies the pipeline that this
version belongs to.

get.summary: Gets a pipeline version by pipeline version ID.

parameters.name: version_id
parameters.description: The ID of the pipeline version to be retrieved.

delete.summary:
Deletes a pipeline version by pipeline version ID. If the deleted pipeline
version is the default pipeline version, the pipeline's default version
changes to the pipeline's most recent pipeline version. If there are no
remaining pipeline versions, the pipeline will have no default version.
Examines the run_service_api.ipynb notebook to learn more about creating a
run using a pipeline version (https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/tools/benchmarks/run_service_api.ipynb).

parameters.name: version_id
parameters.description: The ID of the pipeline version to be deleted.

get.summary: Returns a YAML template that contains the specified pipeline version's description, parameters and metadata.

parameters.name: version_id
parameters.description: The ID of the pipeline version whose template is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description:
A page token to request the next page of results. The token is acquried
from the nextPageToken field of the response from the previous
ListPipelines call.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The number of pipelines to be listed per page. If there are more pipelines
than this number, the response message will contain a valid value in the
nextPageToken field.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
Can be format of "field_name", "field_name asc" or "field_name desc"
Ascending by default.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
A url-encoded, JSON-serialized Filter protocol buffer (see
[filter.proto](https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/backend/api/v1beta1/filter.proto)).

parameters.name: resource_reference_key.type
parameters.description: The type of the resource that referred to.

parameters.name: resource_reference_key.id
parameters.description: The ID of the resource that referred to.

get.summary: Finds a specific pipeline by ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the pipeline to be retrieved.

delete.summary: Deletes a pipeline and its pipeline versions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the pipeline to be deleted.

get.summary: Returns a single YAML template that contains the description, parameters, and metadata associated with the pipeline provided.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the pipeline whose template is to be retrieved.

post.summary: Update the default pipeline version of a specific pipeline.

parameters.name: pipeline_id
parameters.description: The ID of the pipeline to be updated.

parameters.name: version_id
parameters.description: The ID of the default version.

parameters.name: uploadfile
parameters.description: The pipeline to upload. Maximum size of 32MB is supported.

parameters.name: uploadfile
parameters.description: The pipeline to upload. Maximum size of 32MB is supported.

id.description: Output. Unique experiment ID. Generated by API server.

name.description: Required input field. Unique experiment name provided by user.

description.title: Optional input field. Describing the purpose of the experiment

created_at.description: Output. The time that the experiment created.

resource_references.description:
Optional input field. Specify which resource this run belongs to.
For Experiment, the only valid resource reference is a single Namespace.

storage_state.description: Output. Specifies whether this experiment is in archived or available state.

total_size.description: The total number of experiments for the given query.

next_page_token.description: The token to list the next page of experiments.

type.description: The type of the resource that referred to.

id.description: The ID of the resource that referred to.

name.description: The name of the resource that referred to.

relationship.description: Required field. The relationship from referred resource to the object.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

parameters.description:
The runtime parameters of the PipelineSpec. The parameters will be
used to replace the placeholders
at runtime.

pipeline_root.title:
A path in a object store bucket which will be treated as the root
output directory of the pipeline. It is used by the system to
generate the paths of output artifacts. Ref:(https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/components/pipelines/pipeline-root/)

PipelineSpecRuntimeConfig.description: The runtime config of a PipelineSpec.

metric_name.description: Output. The name of the metric.

metric_node_id.description: Output. The ID of the node which reports the metric.

status.description: Output. The status of the metric reporting.

message.description: Output. The detailed message of the error of the reporting.

ReportRunMetricsResponseReportRunMetricR.description:
- UNSPECIFIED: Default value if not present.
 - OK: Indicates successful reporting.
 - INVALID_ARGUMENT: Indicates that the payload of the metric is invalid.
 - DUPLICATE_REPORTING: Indicates that the metric has been reported before.
 - INTERNAL_ERROR: Indicates that something went wrong in the server.

RunMetricFormat.description:
- UNSPECIFIED: Default value if not present.
 - RAW: Display value as its raw format.
 - PERCENTAGE: Display value in percentage format.

total_size.description: The total number of runs for the given query.

next_page_token.description: The token to list the next page of runs.

pipeline_manifest.description:
Output. The runtime JSON manifest of the pipeline, including the status
of pipeline steps and fields need for UI visualization etc.

workflow_manifest.description:
Output. The runtime JSON manifest of the argo workflow.
This is deprecated after pipeline_runtime_manifest is in use.

pipeline_id.description: Optional input field. The ID of the pipeline user uploaded before.

pipeline_name.description:
Optional output field. The name of the pipeline.
Not empty if the pipeline id is not empty.

workflow_manifest.description:
Optional input field. The marshalled raw argo JSON workflow.
This will be deprecated when pipeline_manifest is in use.

pipeline_manifest.description: Optional input field. The raw pipeline JSON spec.

parameters.title:
The parameter user provide to inject to the pipeline JSON.
If a default value of a parameter exist in the JSON,
the value user provided here will replace. V1 only

runtime_config.title: Runtime config of the pipeline. V2 only

data.description: The bytes of the artifact content.

run_id.description: Required. The parent run ID of the metric.

id.description: Output. Unique run ID. Generated by API server.

name.description:
Required input field. Name provided by user,
or auto generated if run is created by scheduled job. Not unique.

storage_state.description: Output. Specify whether this run is in archived or available mode.

description.title: Optional input field. Describing the purpose of the run

pipeline_spec.description:
Required input field.
Describing what the pipeline manifest and parameters to use for the run.

resource_references.description:
Optional input field. Specify which resource this run belongs to.
When creating a run from a particular pipeline version, the pipeline
version can be specified here.

service_account.description: Optional input field. Specify which Kubernetes service account this run uses.

created_at.description: Output. The time that the run created.

scheduled_at.description:
Output. When this run is scheduled to run. This could be different from
created_at. For example, if a run is from a backfilling job that was
supposed to run 2 month ago, the scheduled_at is 2 month ago,
v.s. created_at is the current time.

finished_at.description: Output. The time this run is finished.

status.title:
Output. The status of the run.
One of [Pending, Running, Succeeded, Skipped, Failed, Error]

error.description:
In case any error happens retrieving a run field, only run ID
and the error message is returned. Client has the flexibility of choosing
how to handle error. This is especially useful during listing call.

metrics.description:
Output. The metrics of the run. The metrics are reported by ReportMetrics
API.

name.description:
Required. The user defined name of the metric. It must between 1 and 63
characters long and must conform to the following regular expression:
`[a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?`.

node_id.description:
Required. The runtime node ID which reports the metric. The node ID can be
found in the RunDetail.workflow.Status. Metric with same (node_id, name)
are considerd as duplicate. Only the first reporting will be recorded. Max
length is 128.

number_value.description: The number value of the metric.

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

JobMode.description:
Required input.

 - DISABLED: The job won't schedule any run if disabled.

start_time.title: The start time of the cron job

end_time.title: The end time of the cron job

cron.title:
The cron string. For details how to compose a cron, visit
ttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron

apiCronSchedule.title: CronSchedule allow scheduling the job with unix-like cron

id.description: Output. Unique run ID. Generated by API server.

name.description: Required input field. Job name provided by user. Not unique.

description.title: Optional input field. Describing the purpose of the job

pipeline_spec.description:
Required input field.
Describing what the pipeline manifest and parameters to use
for the scheduled job.

resource_references.description: Optional input field. Specify which resource this job belongs to.

service_account.description: Optional input field. Specify which Kubernetes service account this job uses.

max_concurrency.title:
Required input field.
Specify how many runs can be executed concurrently. Rage [1-10]

trigger.description:
Required input field.
Specify how a run is triggered. Support cron mode or periodic mode.

created_at.description: Output. The time this job is created.

updated_at.description: Output. The last time this job is updated.

status.title:
Output. The status of the job.
One of [Enable, Disable, Error]

error.description:
In case any error happens retrieving a job field, only job ID
and the error message is returned. Client has the flexibility of choosing
how to handle error. This is especially useful during listing call.

enabled.description: Input. Whether the job is enabled or not.

no_catchup.description:
Optional input field. Whether the job should catch up if behind schedule.
If true, the job will only schedule the latest interval if behind schedule.
If false, the job will catch up on each past interval.

total_size.description: The total number of jobs for the given query.

next_page_token.description: The token to list the next page of jobs.

start_time.title: The start time of the periodic job

end_time.title: The end time of the periodic job

interval_second.title: The time interval between the starting time of consecutive jobs

apiPeriodicSchedule.title: PeriodicSchedule allow scheduling the job periodically with certain interval

apiTrigger.description: Trigger defines what starts a pipeline run.

template.description:
The template of the pipeline specified in a GetTemplate request, or of a
pipeline version specified in a GetPipelinesVersionTemplate request.

next_page_token.description: The token to list the next page of pipeline versions.

total_size.description: The total number of pipeline versions for the given query.
The total number of pipelines for the given query.

next_page_token.description: The token to list the next page of pipelines.

id.description: Output. Unique pipeline ID. Generated by API server.

created_at.description: Output. The time this pipeline is created.

name.description:
Optional input field. Pipeline name provided by user. If not specified,
file name is used as pipeline name.

description.description: Optional input field. Describing the purpose of the job.

parameters.description:
Output. The input parameters for this pipeline.
TODO(jingzhang36): replace this parameters field with the parameters field
inside PipelineVersion when all usage of the former has been changed to use
the latter.

url.description:
Input. Required. The URL to the source of the pipeline.
This is required when creating the pipeine through CreatePipeline API.

error.description:
In case any error happens retrieving a pipeline field, only pipeline ID
and the error message is returned. Client has the flexibility of choosing
how to handle error. This is especially useful during listing call.

default_version.title:
Output only. The default version of the pipeline. As of now, the latest
version is used as default. (In the future, if desired by customers, we
can allow them to set default version.)

resource_references.description:
Input field. Specify which resource this pipeline belongs to.
For Pipeline, the only valid resource reference is a single Namespace.

id.description: Output. Unique version ID. Generated by API server.

name.description: Optional input field. Version name provided by user.

created_at.description: Output. The time this pipeline version is created.

parameters.description: Output. The input parameters for this pipeline.

code_source_url.description: Input. Optional. Pipeline version code source.

package_url.description:
Input. Required. Pipeline version package url.
Whe calling CreatePipelineVersion API method, need to provide one package
file location.

resource_references.description:
Input. Required. E.g., specify which pipeline this pipeline version belongs
to.

description.description: Input. Optional. Description for the pipeline version.

pipeline_url.description: URL of the pipeline definition or the pipeline version definition.

multi_user.title: Returns if KFP in multi-user mode
